reviews.text: Stayed for two nights with our infant son and everything was simply delightful. The hotel staff attended to our every need and request. Breakfast, by Paris standards, was substantial and of good quality. The location is great for walking Paris or for catching the Metro. The room was spacious and quiet and we found the courtyard area to be quite relaxing. Definitely recommend the Nicolo to anyone looking for a comfortable and affordable hotel in Paris.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, great room.... just great!!!
Delightful hotel, friendly and very clean, stylish decor
reviews.text: Stayed four nights. Quiet location and lovely internal courtyard/garden. All the reception staff spoke some English for which we were grateful, high standard of breakfast and cleanliness throughout. Loved the decor and the tiny lift added to the hotel's character. Felt secure and there was a free safety deposit box in the wardrobe. Being English we missed the coffee facilities in the room but that was the only slight downside. The staff were friendly without being too fussy. Took seconds to check in and out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay. Nice breakfast in the morning. Convenient to the Metro and the front desk was always courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Great little hotel. Close to Metro and easy access to the great sites in Paris.

reviews.text: My 14-yr old son and I spent a week in Paris. We selected Nicolo because of its excellent reviews, and we were not disappointed. Very comfortable. Great breakfasts. For dinner, we sometimes bought take-out at the bakery and cheese shops just down the street. We then took these into the garden of the hotel. The garden has a lovely sitting area, and we were very happy. The walk to the Tour Eiffel is reasonable, about 10 minutes. Close enough. I loved being in a real neighborhood. I will definitely return to this hotel!
reviews.title: perfect - location and hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is well placed especially within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and the central part of Trocadero. However, the lift was not big enough and the service always forgot to replenish on toileteries which were used overnight. Breakfast was a nightmare as we would always wake up early in the morning to be served with the same things i.e croissants, tea/coffee, orange juice, butter and jam. Nothing exceptional about the hotel itself except for its strategic location.
reviews.title: Strategically situated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful, friendly, knowledgeable staff who spoke English (and didn't mind doing so!); close to lots of good, local Parisien restaurants and shops; close to Metro and Eiffel Tower; room was larger than anything else we've experienced in Paris - and we had a double sink! We've visited Paris quite a few times; the neighborhood is the best we've experienced, and the hotel very much worth the reasonable price. An fyi for Americans: as is often found in European hotels, two beds are put together to make a double when requested...ours was very comfortable!
reviews.title: Charming, Clean, Larger Rooms and Incredibly Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for nine nights. Arrived after 1am with no problems at all (the room was ready and the person at the reception knew who we were before we said anything - very friendly, by the way).
reviews.title: Charming hotel

reviews.text: Our room was in front of the little garden the hotel has. We had the breakfast there every morning which was just delightful. The breakfast, itself, was very good. Fresh products, homemade cake, delicious bread and fruit. All served by a very nice lady.
reviews.title: Very Charming....

reviews.text: The hotel is quite charming. Decorated in a very personal style, quite different from the mainstream impersonal hotels we are used to book. After a tiring day of sightseeing across Paris, it was comforting the idea of returning to such a beautiful, relaxing place.
reviews.title: What a wonderful experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In Paris, i will choose no other hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel from the reviews on Trip Adviser and I'm very glad we did as it more than lived up to our expectations. Arriving after midnight because of a problem with our flight we were grateful for a warm welcome. We were delighted by the very stylish decor and the quiet and colourful courtyard garden. We liked the location. Passy was quiet in August and had some very nice shops, but as has been said already wasn't very lively at night so we travelled further afield. This meant a bit of journey home in the late evening but the metro is only 5 minutes walk and the area felt very safe. Breakfast (included in the price) was very good too. Will definitely use this hotel again and strongly recommend it. Warning: our room was on the 5th floor and the lift is extremely small and would not suit anyone with claustrophobia!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel with great staff and excellent location. Breakfast each morning is absolutely delicous. The staff are friendly and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Little Hotel Tucked Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main reason we chose to stay at this hotel was due to the reviews we saw on Tripadvisor and I'm so glad we did. A great hotel in a nice area, very close to the Metro station and a short walk from the Eiffel Tower. The staff were alos very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: Beautiful room, comfy bed, great garden, friendly staff. Short walk to Eifell Tower and in a great area for shopping.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel Nicolo is set back of the street throhg a passage way , but the whole are feels safe for a central capitol city.
reviews.title: Quiet, plesent Hotel in a safe area

reviews.text: I loved my long weekend stay at the Hotel Nicolo back in 2008, and I will be heading back there as it was so lovely and everything | was looking for. The staff could not do enough for us and were so accomodating, it made our stay so much more lovelier.
reviews.title: Charming Parisian Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price is also great value for money, we had a great sized twin bedroom,, the view was of the courtyard below (which is lovely and quaint, and great if you want to rest in between sight seeing Paris). and the bathroom was much bigger than you expect from a paris hotel. Breakfast was continental (mais oui!) and was delicious, included in the price of the room so a complete bargain.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the location also, 10 mins walk to the Passy metro station and 15 mins walk to the Effiel Tower. I loved being in the Passy district, I felt like I was in a Parisian neightbourhood, not in the tourist trap, it was so lovely to come back to each evening.
reviews.title: Definitely recommended

reviews.text: Great little shops and cafes too, oh and the pattiseries!!
reviews.title: The best hotel de Charme of Paris!

reviews.text: I loved my stay at the Hotel Nicolo and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in a clean, modern and charming hotel in Paris that offers value for money.
reviews.title: more than expected!
